meanings.sent1: The old books in the abandoned library were moldering away on the dusty shelves.
meanings.sent2: Leaves left unattended in the garden start moldering and turning into compost.
meanings.sent3: The forgotten sandwich in the lunchbox was moldering into a mushy mess.
meanings.sent4: Time had a way of moldering memories into fragments of the past.
meanings.sent5: The damp wood was moldering quietly in the dark corner of the shed.

meanings.definition: To crumble or break down over time
meanings.sent1: Neglected buildings in the ghost town were slowly moldering into ruins.
meanings.sent2: The ancient statue was moldering away, losing its intricate details.
meanings.sent3: The cake left on the counter was moldering into a pile of crumbs.
meanings.sent4: Years of neglect had caused the once grand mansion to molder into rubble.
meanings.sent5: The old parchment was moldering, turning to dust at the slightest touch.

meanings.definition: To become soft or pulpy, as by decomposing
meanings.sent1: The fruit left in the bowl was moldering and attracting fruit flies.
meanings.sent2: The vegetables forgotten in the fridge were moldering and emitting a foul odor.
meanings.sent3: The bread left out on the counter was moldering into a gooey mess.
meanings.sent4: The fallen tree in the forest was moldering, providing nutrients for new growth.
meanings.sent5: The damp cloth was moldering in the damp cellar, forgotten by its owner.
